item.title: Survey: Dabawenyos ‘uninterested’ in being OFWs - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Survey: Dabawenyos ‘uninterested’ in being OFWs  SunStar Philippines

MAJORITY of Dabawenyos signify their disinterest to work abroad, despite their desire to look for a second job, a local survey revealed. In the City Wide Social Survey series 10 (CWSS 10) at the Ateneo de Davao University (AdDU) last Friday, December 7, 2018, it showed that 88.1 percent said that they have no aspiration to live or work abroad. Mildred Estanda of the Social Research Training and Development Office (SRTDO) said that two of every five Dabawenyos or 79.3 percent are looking for an additional work because their income is not enough. However, despite the need for second job to su...

item.title: CDRRMO conducts drills instead of costly trainings - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
CDRRMO conducts drills instead of costly trainings  SunStar Philippines

DAVAO City Disaster Risk Reduction Management Office (CDRRMO) said trainings for disaster preparedness are costly that is why they only conduct drills in the communities so that more people can participate. “Costly ang mga trainings and also yung availability pa of the resource people like yung mga training providers (Trainings are costly and we have problems on the availability of resource persons such as training providers),” CDRRMO head Rodrigo Bustillo said in a phone interview with SunStar Davao Friday, December 7, 2018. “Kaya nga as much as we want to capture the whole Davao City, per...

item.title: Davao Region grads dominate in LET - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Davao Region grads dominate in LET  SunStar Philippines

DAVAO Region graduates of Bachelor of Elementary Education dominated the list of top ten in the September 2018 Licensure Examination for Teachers of the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC). University of Southeastern Philippines (Usep)-Davao and Tagum graduates, Rhea Joy Yebes Genson and Mariel Cataluña Saladaga ranked Top 1 in Elementary Education LET garning an 89.80 percent average. “I feel so blessed and overwhelming kaayo ang grasya na gihatag sa atoa sa Ginoo (The blessings of the lord was overwhelming).” Genson said during an interview with Sunstar Davao Friday. Also placed in f...

item.title: Usep, UM grads top Secondary LET - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Usep, UM grads top Secondary LET  SunStar Philippines

A GRADUATE of the University of Southeastern Philippines (Usep)-Davao thought that it was just a prank when he saw his name in the top one spot in the recent results of the Secondary Education LET 2018. Francis Dave Cabanting of the Usep-Davao and Samuel John Parreño of the University of Mindanao (UM)-Digos were ranked first in this year's LET Secondary Education with 92.80 percent rating. Cabanting said in an interview with SunStar Davao that he did not believe at first because he thought it was just a prank, adding that he was thankful to God and his family especially that it was his birt...

item.title: Ledesma: Fun run in Davao - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Ledesma: Fun run in Davao  SunStar Philippines

Elections are months away but in Davao del Norte intense under currents are felt in not a few towns with the epicenter in District 1, the main battle ground that pits incumbent Governor Anthony “AGR” del Rosario and ex-speaker Pantaleon “Bebot” Alvarez in the congressional derby. As we all knew, AGR and Bebot, include 2nd District Rep. Antonio “Tonyboy” Floirendo, were a team. A formidable one. In Hiligaynon we describe that alliance as “isa lang ka tuhog,” in Cebuano “usa ra ka tuhog” while in Tagalog we say “isang tiklis lang.” But also not alien to us was the sudden and surprising exit o...

item.title: UV takes Game 1 - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
UV takes Game 1  SunStar Philippines

THE Green Lancers defeat Naga City Academy in first of their best-of-three PCCL 2018 national championship in Davao City. Visayas-Mindanao champion University of the Visayas Green Lancers grabbed Game 1 of the best-of-three PCCL 2018 national championship by beating Naga City Academy, 76-72, Thursday afternoon at the Arcadia Active Lifestyle and Fitness Center gym in Matina, Davao City. Rey Suerte poured in 21 baskets as Gileant Delator added 16. Michael Maestre and Bassieru Sackor scored identical eight points. Both teams engaged in a see-saw battle, figuring in a series of lead changes wi...

item.title: Dabawenyos happy with LGU officials - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Dabawenyos happy with LGU officials  SunStar Philippines

MAJORITY of the Dabawenyos said they are satisfied with the performance of the current local government officials in the city. In the City Wide Social Survey Series 10 (CWSS 10) of the Ateneo de Davao University (AdDu)on Friday, December 7, 89.8 percent of Dabawenyos said that they are “very satisfied” and 7.9 percent are “somewhat satisfied” with the performance of Davao City Mayor Sara Duterte-Carpio. Vice Mayor Bernard Al-ag got 53.7 percent “very satisfied” and 22.5 percent “somewhat satisfied” performance rate as a government official. “This is an affirmation that we are effectively re...

item.title: Prestige homes: Innovating the way we live - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Prestige homes: Innovating the way we live  SunStar Philippines

WITH the aim of responding to the growing real estate and construction industry in Davao City, Prestige Homes Realty and Development Corporation (PHRDC) continues to innovate ways to better give quality and trust-worthy housing services for the families in the city. The company is ready to compete in the industry as it strives to discover more. Some clients find PHRDC attractive as it rewards them convenience, big savings, and well-designed developments. PHRDC’s current project Granville is strategically located in the south of Davao City, in Catalunan Pequeño. The simplicity and tranquilit...

item.title: Cebu Landmasters bullish with Davao - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Cebu Landmasters bullish with Davao  SunStar Philippines

CEBU Landmasters, Inc. (CLI) is clearly bullish with Davao City as it ventures into mixed-use developments here. In partnership with Davao’s Villa-Abrille family and joint ventures from YHEST Realty & Development Corp and YHES Inc., CLI launched two key landmark projects: Davao Global Township (DGT) and The Paragon Davao. The 22-hectare DGT which will be located at the former Matina Golf Club, will be transformed into a central business district. DGT will feature an office tower, two residential towers, retail buildings, a Cineplex hall, and a convention center. These sophisticated faciliti...

item.title: Metro Manila police chief asks Davao cops to 'LBC' Trillanes arrest warrant - Rappler
item.description:
Metro Manila police chief asks Davao cops to 'LBC' Trillanes arrest warrant  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Hearing of the newest arrest warrant against Senator Antonio Trillanes IV, Metro Manila top cop Director Guillermo Eleazar asked for a copy for implementation. After all, watching over Metro Manila, Eleazar also has jurisdiction over where Trillanes works, at the Senate in Pasay City. But there was a problem: The warrant was issued in Davao City, the President's bailiwick which is hundreds of miles away. Speaking to Rappler in a phone interview, Eleazar said he asked Davao cops to send a copy to them through "LBC," the popular shipping company. Trillanes was ordered ar...

item.title: Velez: Who gains when Lumad schools are closed? - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Velez: Who gains when Lumad schools are closed?  SunStar Philippines

THE Lumad schools are in the news again. But instead of the campaign of saving these schools from attacks, there is another group now that is now calling for their closure. Making the rounds in press conferences in Davao and in Manila is the group called Mindanao Indigenous Peoples Council of Elders (MIPCEL) led by Joel Unad, who accuse both the Salugpongan Community Learning Center in Southern Mindanao and the Alternative Learning Center for Agricultural and Livelihood Development (Alcadev) as communist fronts. Also included here is a faction of the Talaingod leaders led by its IP represen...

item.title: Prestige Homes: Not just a house but a home - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Prestige Homes: Not just a house but a home  SunStar Philippines

MANY real estate companies today aim to provide a house, but not everyone succeed to make it a home. With the growing urban population in Davao City, families dream of living together in a comfortable home because there is no place like one’s own dwelling for sprouting dreams. Seven years ago, Prestige Homes Realty and Development Realty Corp. (PHRDC) made every Filipino family’s dream as their own. Dreaming of a community where the basic unit of the society could live in harmony with house services that they deserve. Embedded in the vision of the company is the promise to provide housing s...

item.title: Davao court orders Trillanes arrest for libel - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

Senator Antonio Trillanes IV. File MANILA- (UPDATE) A Davao court ordered Friday the arrest of Senator Antonio Trillanes IV for libel. The Davao City Regional Trial Court Branch 54 has set bail at P24,000. LOOK: Warrant of arrest issued by Davao court against Sen. Antonio Trillanes over the libel case filed by ex-Davao City Vice Mayor Paolo Duterte and Manases Carpio. pic.twitter.com/Ro3gbMdxgN — Mike Navallo (@mikenavallo) December 7, 2018 It can be recalled that President Rodrigo Duterte's son, Paolo, filed a libel case against Trillanes in September, a year after the senator accused him ...

item.title: Y-Speak: Mindanao now - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Y-Speak: Mindanao now  SunStar Philippines

MINDANAO has always been left behind in terms of economic growth and prosperity compared to Luzon and Visayas. This is because the numbers of investors in Mindanao is low compared to the other two island groups. Statistics from the World Development Indicators of World Bank displayed that Mindanao's average growth since 1975 to 2014 was 3.4 percent. However, Luzon has 4.1 percent, and Visayas has 3.9 percent; the National Capital Region with 4.3 percent and the national average of 3.9 percent. With few investors in Mindanao, unemployment and poverty are visible leaving some people in Mindan...
